tit.e: Square Front, Square Back Tomb Mounds
Square Front, Square Back Tomb Mounds

sen.j: 前方後方墳（ぜんぽうこうほうふん）とは、古墳の墳形の一種である。
sen.e: A front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumulus (called zenpo koho-fun in Japanese) refers to a kind of forms of kofun (tumulus).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Square front, square back tomb mounds refers to a form of tumuli.
Square front, square back tomb mounds refers to a form of tumuli.

sen.j: そして、特に東日本の前期古墳に多く存在する。
sen.e: Especially, it is found in many early-stage tumuli in eastern Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Especially, it is found in many early-stage tumuli in eastern Japan.
Especially, it is found in many early-stage tumuli in eastern Japan.

sen.j: その起源は、方形の弥生時代の墓制墳丘墓への通路が変化し、突出部へと代わっていき成立したと推測されている。
sen.e: With regard to its origin, it is supposed that a passage leading to the square tomb that was covered with a heap of earth in the Yayoi Period was transformed into the protruding portion of the tumulus and, as a result, such a tumulus was formed.
It is supposed that a passage to a square funkyubo (grave mound built in Yayoi period) in Yayoi period changed into the protruding portion, then formed a square front, square back tomb Mound.
It is supposed that a passage to a square funkyubo (grave mound built in Yayoi period) in Yayoi period changed into the protruding portion, then formed a square front, square back tomb Mound.

sen.j: 東日本の出現期古墳の多くは、前方後方墳であることが分かってきた。
sen.e: It has been learned that many of the kofun that were built in eastern Japan during the appearance period were front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli.
It has been learned that many of the tumuli built in eastern Japan during the appearance period were square front, square back tomb mounds.
It has been learned that many of the tumuli built in eastern Japan during the appearance period were square front, square back tomb mounds.

sen.j: 主に弥生時代後期末から前方後方墳の祖形である前方後方形墳丘墓が造られ始めた。
sen.e: The antecedent image of front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli, or the tombs covered with a heap of earth that were quadrilateral in the front and square in the rear, began to be constructed mainly at the end of the late Yayoi Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Mainly in the end of the late Yayoi period, square front, square back funkyubo, which were the prototype of square front, square back tomb mounds, began to be built.
Mainly in the end of the late Yayoi period, square front, square back funkyubo, which were the prototype of square front, square back tomb mounds, began to be built.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期前半に東日本（中部・関東地方）で前方後方墳がよく造られる。
sen.e: Many front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli were built in eastern Japan (or in the Chubu and Kanto regions) in the early part of the early Kofun Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Many square front, square back tomb mounds were built in eastern Japan (the Chubu and Kanto regions) in the early part of the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
Many square front, square back tomb mounds were built in eastern Japan (the Chubu and Kanto regions) in the early part of the early Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 西日本の前方後円墳の世界に対し、東日本は前方後方墳の世界であったと捉えることができる。
sen.e: Eastern Japan can be perceived as the world of front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli in contrast to western Japan, which is the world of keyhole-shaped tumuli.
While western Japan can be perceived as the world of keyhole-shaped mounds, eastern Japan as the world of square front, square back tomb mounds.
While western Japan can be perceived as the world of keyhole-shaped mounds, eastern Japan as the world of square front, square back tomb mounds.

sen.j: ただ、100メートルを超える規模の大きな前方後方墳5基が大和に集中している。
sen.e: However, five large-scale front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli that exceed 100 meters are concentrated in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, five large-scale square front, square back tomb mounds that exceed 100 meters are concentrated in Yamato.
However, five large-scale square front, square back tomb mounds that exceed 100 meters are concentrated in Yamato.

sen.j: あとは下野に2基、上野・越中・美濃・駿河に1基ずつ存在する。
sen.e: And as for the rest, there are two in Shimotsuke and one each in Ueno, Ecchu, Mino, and Suruga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: As for the rest, two in Shimotsuke and one each in Kozuke, Etchu, Mino, and Suruga.
sen.cmt: 「上野」は「上野国」として修正しました。
sen.e: As for the rest, two in Shimotsuke and one each in Kozuke, Etchu, Mino, and Suruga.

sen.j: １つの説として、政治勢力としては、西日本は邪馬台国を中心とした政治連合であり、東日本は濃尾平野の狗奴国を中心として形成された政治連合であったが、東の狗奴国中心の連合は、西日本の邪馬台国連合ほど強固な連合ではなかったとするものがある。
sen.e: According to an opinion concerning political forces, western Japan was a political union built around the Yamatai-koku Kingdom and eastern Japan was a political union formed around the Kina-koku Kingdom in the Nobi Plain, but the union centering on the Kina-koku Kingdom in the east was not as strong as the one built around the Yamatai-koku Kingdom in western Japan.

In an opinion, the political union centered on Yamatai-koku Kingdom, which had political power in the western Japan, was said to be stronger than that centered on Kuna-koku Kingdom in Nobi Plain having political power in eastern Japan.

In an opinion, the political union centered on Yamatai-koku Kingdom, which had political power in the western Japan, was said to be stronger than that centered on Kuna-koku Kingdom in Nobi Plain having political power in eastern Japan.

sen.j: また、この濃尾平野の勢力は、魏志倭人伝に記載のある倭の女王卑弥呼の邪馬台国と闘った狗奴国との関係を想定する学者もいる。
sen.e: Some scholars also link the forces in the Nobi Plain with the Kina-koku Kingdom, which fought against the Yamatai-koku Kingdom ruled by Himiko, the queen of Wa-koku (that is, the oldest recorded name for Japan), described in Gishiwajin-den (the Wei Chronicles).

Some scholars also link the forces in the Nobi Plain with the Kina-koku Kingdom, which fought against the Yamatai-koku Kingdom ruled by Himiko, the queen of Wa-koku (that is, the oldest recorded name for Japan), described in Gishiwajinden (literally, an 'Account of the Wa' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty").
sen.cmt: 一部用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Some scholars also link the forces in the Nobi Plain with the Kina-koku Kingdom, which fought against the Yamatai-koku Kingdom ruled by Himiko, the queen of Wa-koku (that is, the oldest recorded name for Japan), described in Gishiwajinden (literally, an 'Account of the Wa' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty").

sen.j: 日本列島には約500基の前方後方墳が存在する。
sen.e: There are approximately 500 front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli in the Japanese Archipelago.
There are approximately 500 square front, square back tomb mounds in the Japanese Archipelago.
There are approximately 500 square front, square back tomb mounds in the Japanese Archipelago.

tit.j: 弥生前方後方形墳丘墓
tit.e: Front-Quadrilateral Rear-Square-Shaped Tombs Covered with a Heap of Earth in the Yayoi Period
Square Front, Square Back Funkyubo in the Yayoi Period
Square Front, Square Back Funkyubo in the Yayoi Period

sen.j: 愛知県尾西市西上免遺跡で発見された前方後方形墳丘墓は墳丘長約40メートルもある。
sen.e: The mound of the tomb covered with a heap of earth that was found in Nishi Jomen Remains in Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, has a length of about forty meters.
The square front, square back funkyubo found in Nishi Jomen Remains in Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, has a length of about 40 meters.
The square front, square back funkyubo found in Nishi Jomen Remains in Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, has a length of about 40 meters.

sen.j: 前方後方形墳丘墓から前方後方墳への成立に濃尾平野が重要な役割を果たしたと考えられている。
sen.e: The Nobi Plain is believed to have played an important role in the formation of front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli out of the tombs covered with a heap of earth that were quadrilateral in the front and square in the back.
The Nobi Plain is believed to have played an important role in the formation of square front, square back tomb mounds out of the square front, square back funkyubo.
The Nobi Plain is believed to have played an important role in the formation of square front, square back tomb mounds out of the square front, square back funkyubo.

sen.j: 3世紀前半の弥生時代終末期頃、東海地方では方形墓の一辺に突出状の祭壇を設ける墓が流行した。
sen.e: Square tombs with a projecting altar in one of the sides became popular in the Tokai region in the former part of the third century around the end of the Yayoi Period.
Square graves with a projecting altar in a side became popular in the Tokai region in the early third century around the end of the Yayoi period.
Square graves with a projecting altar in a side became popular in the Tokai region in the early third century around the end of the Yayoi period.

sen.j: その例としては愛知県の廻間遺跡SZ01墳丘墓があげられる。
sen.e: The SZ01 Tomb covered with a heap of earth in the Hasama Remains is one example.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The SZ01 Funkyubo of the Hasama Remains in Aichi Prefecture is one example.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「愛知県」を補足しました。
sen.e: The SZ01 Funkyubo of the Hasama Remains in Aichi Prefecture is one example.

sen.j: これは祖形と考えられる。
sen.e: And it is considered the antecedent image.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is considered the prototype.
It is considered the prototype.

sen.j: この墳形は西は京都府から東は千葉県までひろがった。
sen.e: The tumulus shape spread from Kyoto Prefecture in the west to Chiba Prefecture in the east.
The tumulus shape spread from Kyoto Prefecture in the west to Chiba Prefecture in the east.
The tumulus shape spread from Kyoto Prefecture in the west to Chiba Prefecture in the east.

tit.e: The Distribution, Scale, and so on
The Distribution, Scale, and so on

sen.j: 現在知られている前方後方墳の規模分布を調べてみると墳丘の長さが70メートル以上は34基あり、60～70メートルは33基、50～60メートルは48基ある。
sen.e: The investigation of the scale distribution of the front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli that are known to exist today shows that there are thirty-four tumuli whose burial mound is longer than seventy meters, thirty-three tumuli with a sixty-to-seventy meter-long burial mound, and forty-eight tumuli with a fifty-to-sixty meter-long burial mound.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The investigation of the scale distribution of the square front, square back tomb mounds that are known to exist today shows that there are 34 tumuli whose burial mound is longer than 70 meters, 33 tumuli with a 60 to 70 meter-long, and 48 tumuli with a 50 to 60 meter-long.

The investigation of the scale distribution of the square front, square back tomb mounds that are known to exist today shows that there are 34 tumuli whose burial mound is longer than 70 meters, 33 tumuli with a 60 to 70 meter-long, and 48 tumuli with a 50 to 60 meter-long.

sen.j: 以下規模が縮小するとともに数が増加していく。
sen.e: It also reveals that after this the number increases as the scale becomes smaller.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: After this the number increases as the scale becomes smaller.
After this the number increases as the scale becomes smaller.

sen.j: 70メートルを超える前方後方墳の旧国別の築造数は下記の通り。
sen.e: The numerical breakdown of the front-quadrilateral, rear-square-shaped tumuli exceeding seventy meters using old provincial names is as below.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The number of square front, square back tomb mounds over 70 meter-long are listed by former provinces
The number of square front, square back tomb mounds over 70 meter-long are listed by former provinces

sen.j: 出雲・美作・播磨・摂津・伊勢・尾張・三河・能登・常陸が各1基。
sen.e: There is one tumulus each in Izumo, Mimasaka, Harima, Settsu, Ise, Owari, Mikawa, Noto, and Hitachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: One mounds: Izumo, Mimasaka, Harima, Settsu, Ise, Owari, Mikawa, Noto, and Hitachi.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: One mounds: Izumo, Mimasaka, Harima, Settsu, Ise, Owari, Mikawa, Noto, and Hitachi.

sen.j: 美濃・駿河・越中・上野・出羽が各2基。
sen.e: There are two tumuli each in Mino, Suruga, Ecchu, Ueno, and Dewa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Two mounds: Mino, Suruga, Etchu, Kazusa, and Dewa.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し読みを変えました。
sen.e: Two mounds: Mino, Suruga, Etchu, Kazusa, and Dewa.

sen.j: 山城・陸奥が各3基。
sen.e: There are three tumuli each in Yamashiro and Mutsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Three mounds: Yamashiro and Mutsu.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Three mounds: Yamashiro and Mutsu.

sen.j: 下野が4基。
sen.e: There are four tumuli in Shimotsuke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Four mounds: Shimotsuke.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Four mounds: Shimotsuke.

sen.j: 大和が5基である。
sen.e: And there are five tumuli in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Five mounds: Yamato.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Five mounds: Yamato.

sen.j: 大規模前方後方墳も大和国に集中しているといえる。
sen.e: It can be said that large-scale front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli are localized in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It can be said that large-scale square front, square back tomb mounds are concentrated in Yamato.
It can be said that large-scale square front, square back tomb mounds are concentrated in Yamato.

sen.j: さらに、100メートルを超える前方後方墳5基が大和に集中している。
sen.e: Furthermore, five front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli over 100 meters are also concentrated in Yamato.
Furthermore, five square front, square back tomb mounds over 100 meters are also concentrated in Yamato.
Furthermore, five square front, square back tomb mounds over 100 meters are also concentrated in Yamato.

sen.j: また、日本最長の前方後方墳は、天理市の西山古墳（180メートル、古墳時代前期）である。
sen.e: In addition, Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus (180 meters, the early Kofun Period) in Tenri City is the longest front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumulus in Japan.
In addition, Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus (180 meters, the early Kofun period) in Tenri City is the longest square front, square back tomb mound in Japan.
In addition, Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus (180 meters, the early Kofun period) in Tenri City is the longest square front, square back tomb mound in Japan.

sen.j: 同市には羽多子塚古墳（144メートル、同前期）、新山古墳（137メートル）、下池山古墳（120メートル、同初期）、フサギ塚古墳（110メートル、）マバカ古墳（74メートル、同最初期？）、ノムギ古墳（63メートル、同最初期？）、星塚古墳（56メートル）などが存在する。
sen.e: There are also Hatagozuka-kofun Tumulus (144 meters, the early Kofun Period), Shinyama-kofun Tumulus (137 meters), Shimoikeyama-kofun Tumulus (120 meters, the early Kofun Period), Fusagizuka-kofun Tumulus (110 meters), Mabaka-kofun Tumulus (seventy-four meters, the very beginning of the Kofun Period?), Nomugi-kofun Tumulus (sixty-three meters, the very beginning of the Kofun Period?), Hoshizuka-kofun Tumulus (fifty-six meters), and so on in the same city.

There are also Hatagozuka-kofun Tumulus (144 meters, the early Kofun period), Shinyama-kofun Tumulus (137 meters), Shimoikeyama-kofun Tumulus (120 meters, the beginning of Kofun period), Fusagizuka-kofun Tumulus (110 meters), Mabaka-kofun Tumulus (74 meters, the very beginning of the Kofun period?), Nomugi-kofun Tumulus (63 meters, the very beginning of the Kofun period?), Hoshizuka-kofun Tumulus (56 meters), and so on in the same city.
sen.cmt: 用語を変更し、アラビア数字に統一しました。
sen.e: There are also Hatagozuka-kofun Tumulus (144 meters, the early Kofun period), Shinyama-kofun Tumulus (137 meters), Shimoikeyama-kofun Tumulus (120 meters, the beginning of Kofun period), Fusagizuka-kofun Tumulus (110 meters), Mabaka-kofun Tumulus (74 meters, the very beginning of the Kofun period?), Nomugi-kofun Tumulus (63 meters, the very beginning of the Kofun period?), Hoshizuka-kofun Tumulus (56 meters), and so on in the same city.

sen.j: ただ、憤丘最長の西山古墳は、前方後方形の基壇の上に前方後円形が乗っかる。
sen.e: However, in the case of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus that has the longest burial mound, a keyhole shape is placed on top of a front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped base.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, in the case of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus that has the longest burial mound, a keyhole shape is placed on top of a square front, square back shape base.
However, in the case of Nishiyama-kofun Tumulus that has the longest burial mound, a keyhole shape is placed on top of a square front, square back shape base.

sen.j: このように非常に奇妙な形をしている。
sen.e: Hence, it has a very odd shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Hence, it has a very odd shape.
Hence, it has a very odd shape.

sen.j: 東海地方の旧国名でいえば美濃・尾張・伊勢・三河などの濃尾平野を中心とする地域では、前方後方墳は36基、前方後円墳は49基確認されている。
sen.e: If the old provincial names of the Tokai region are used, thirty-six front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli as well as forty-nine keyhole-shaped tumuli have been confirmed in the areas around the Nobi Plain, such as Mino, Owari, Ise, and Mikawa.
In Mino, Owari, Ise, and Mikawa in former provinces' name of Tokai region, where are centered on Nobi Plain, 36 square front, square back tomb mounds and 49 keyhole-shaped tomb mounds are found.
In Mino, Owari, Ise, and Mikawa in former provinces' name of Tokai region, where are centered on Nobi Plain, 36 square front, square back tomb mounds and 49 keyhole-shaped tomb mounds are found.

sen.j: 規模の上では、憤丘の長さ80メートルを超す前方後方墳は少ない。
sen.e: As regards the scale, there are few front-quadrilateral, rear-square-shaped tumuli, whose burial mound is longer than eighty meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: As for the scale, square front, square back tomb with over 80 meters long mound are a few.
As for the scale, square front, square back tomb with over 80 meters long mound are a few.

sen.j: 最大で粉糠山古墳（美濃）の100メートル。
sen.e: The largest is the Konukayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino) that has 100 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The largest is the Konukayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino) that has 100 meters.
The largest is the Konukayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino) that has 100 meters.

sen.j: 83メートルの北山古墳（美濃）、約80メートルの東之宮古墳（尾張）、81メートルの桜井二子古墳（三河）、71メートルの向山古墳（伊勢）などが大きな方である。
sen.e: Relatively large ones are eighty-three-meter Kitayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino), approximately eighty-meter Higashinomiya-kofun Tumulus (in Owari), eighty-one-meter Sakurai Futago-kofun Tumulus (in Mikawa), and seventy-one-meter Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (in Ise).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Kitayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino) in 83 meters long, Higashinomiya-kofun Tumulus (in Owari) in approximately 80 meters long, Sakurai Futago-kofun Tumulus (in Mikawa) in 81 meters long, and Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (in Ise) in 71 meters long are relatively larger.

Kitayama-kofun Tumulus (in Mino) in 83 meters long, Higashinomiya-kofun Tumulus (in Owari) in approximately 80 meters long, Sakurai Futago-kofun Tumulus (in Mikawa) in 81 meters long, and Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (in Ise) in 71 meters long are relatively larger.

sen.j: ちなみにこれらの古墳の周辺には90メートル～150メートルの前方後円墳が築造されている。
sen.e: Incidentally, ninty-to-150 meter keyhole-shaped tumuli have been constructed around the tumuli.
Incidentally, 90-to-150 meter keyhole-shaped tomb mounds have been constructed around them.
Incidentally, 90-to-150 meter keyhole-shaped tomb mounds have been constructed around them.

sen.j: これらのことから古墳時代前期には、地域まで憤形と規模による身分秩序が行き渡ってはいなかったと考えられている。
sen.e: These suggest that a status system based on the scale and shape of the tumuli did not extend all over the area in the early Kofun Period.
These suggest that a status system based on the scale and shape of the tumuli did not extend all over the area in the early Kofun period.
These suggest that a status system based on the scale and shape of the tumuli did not extend all over the area in the early Kofun period.

sen.j: 外表施設では、前方後円・後方墳ともに葺石が葺がれている。
sen.e: The external facilities are covered with fuki-ishi (stones covering the surface of the burial mound) in the case of both keyhole-shaped and front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The external facilities are covered with fukiishi (stones covering the surface of the burial mound) both in keyhole-shaped and square front, square back tomb mounds.
The external facilities are covered with fukiishi (stones covering the surface of the burial mound) both in keyhole-shaped and square front, square back tomb mounds.

sen.j: だが、埴輪は後方墳にはほとんどない。
sen.e: However, few haniwa (burial mound figurines) are found in the latter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, few haniwa (burial mound figurines) are found in the square back tomb mounds.
However, few haniwa (burial mound figurines) are found in the square back tomb mounds.

sen.j: 中国地方では前方後方墳は島根県松江周辺に集中して32基みられる。
sen.e: In the Chugoku region, thirty-two front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli are localized in the Matsue area of Shimane Prefecture.
In the Chugoku region, 32 square front, square back tomb mounds are found around Matsue area of Shimane Prefecture.
In the Chugoku region, 32 square front, square back tomb mounds are found around Matsue area of Shimane Prefecture.

sen.j: この地域と高句麗地域との関連が考えられている。
sen.e: This is considered to be the influence of the relationship that existed between this area and Goguryeo.
This is considered to be the influence of the relationship that existed between this area and Goguryeo.
This is considered to be the influence of the relationship that existed between this area and Goguryeo.

sen.j: 最大は、岡山県勝田郡勝央町植月寺山古墳の91.5メートルである。
sen.e: Uetsuki Terayama-kofun Tumulus in Shoo-cho, Katsuta-gun, Okayama Prefecture is the largest, having 91.5 meters.
Uetsuki Terayama-kofun Tumulus in Shoo Town, Katsuta County, Okayama Prefecture is the largest, having 91.5 meters.
Uetsuki Terayama-kofun Tumulus in Shoo Town, Katsuta County, Okayama Prefecture is the largest, having 91.5 meters.

sen.j: 分布では、山口県にほとんど認められない。
sen.e: With regard to the distribution, there are few in Yamaguchi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Regarding the distribution, there are few in Yamaguchi Prefecture.
Regarding the distribution, there are few in Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: そして、鳥取・兵庫北部地方では21基。
sen.e: There are twenty-one tumuli in Tottori and northern Hyogo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: There are 21 mounds in Tottori Prefecture and northern region of Hyogo Prefecture.
There are 21 mounds in Tottori Prefecture and northern region of Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: 広島・岡山・兵庫南部地方では48基みられる。
sen.e: And there are forty-eight tumuli in Hiroshima, Okayama, and southern Hyogo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And there are 48 mounds in Hiroshima and Okayama Prefectures and southern region of Hyogo Prefecture.
And there are 48 mounds in Hiroshima and Okayama Prefectures and southern region of Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: 四国地方では、徳島に2基、愛媛・香川に1基ずつ。
sen.e: In the Shikoku region, there are two tumuli in Tokushima and one tumulus each in Ehime and Kagawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In the Shikoku region, there are 2 mounds in Tokushima Prefecture and 1 each in Ehime and Kagawa Prefectures.
In the Shikoku region, there are 2 mounds in Tokushima Prefecture and 1 each in Ehime and Kagawa Prefectures.

sen.j: 九州地方では、散発的に長崎・対馬に4基、福岡に5基みられる。
sen.e: And in the Kushu region, there are sporadically four tumuli in Nagasaki and Tsushima and five tumuli in Fukushima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: And in the Kushu region, there are sporadically 4 mounds in Nagasaki Prefecture and Tsushima and 5 mounds in Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 読み修正し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: And in the Kushu region, there are sporadically 4 mounds in Nagasaki Prefecture and Tsushima and 5 mounds in Fukuoka Prefecture.

tit.e: The Styles of the Forms of the Tumuli
The Styles of the Forms of the Mounds
The Styles of the Forms of the Mounds

sen.j: 前方部の平面は、矩（く）形、長方形、台形をしている。
sen.e: The plane surface of the front portion is a square, rectangle, or trapezoid.
The plane surface of the front square portion is a rectangle, oblong, or trapezoid.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: The plane surface of the front square portion is a rectangle, oblong, or trapezoid.

sen.j: そして、祭礼を執り行ったと考えられている。
sen.e: And it is believed that festivals were held there.
And it is believed that festivals were held there.
And it is believed that festivals were held there.

sen.j: 後方部の平面は、方形で棺を埋葬する埋葬部を擁している。
sen.e: The plane surface of the rear portion is a square, and it has a burial section where a coffin is buried.
The plane surface of the back square portion is a square, which has a burial section where a coffin was buried.
The plane surface of the back square portion is a square, which has a burial section where a coffin was buried.
